alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 1:54PM CDT until August 10 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND NORTHWESTERN PLAQUEMINES PARISHES... At 154 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. The heavy rain has ended with additional rainfall amounts less than one-half inch possible in the warned area. However, flash flooding in poor-drainage areas is likely still ongoing due to the runoff from the earlier excessive rain. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans, Harvey, Marrero, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Gretna, Westwego, Woodmere, Estelle and Terrytown. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
